title: Domain 4.4: Given a scenario, use common safety procedures.
content:
⚡ Electrostatic Discharge (ESD) Protection

  • ESD straps: 🖐️ Worn on the wrist to ground yourself and prevent static discharge.
  • ESD mats: 📎 Placed on work surfaces to safely discharge static electricity.
  • Equipment grounding: 🪛 Ensures systems are properly grounded to avoid shocks or damage.
  • Proper power handling: 🔌 Always unplug devices before servicing; use surge protectors to avoid electrical spikes.

📦 Proper Component Handling and Storage

  • Antistatic bags: 💼 Used to store and transport static-sensitive parts like RAM and motherboards.
  • Compliance with regulations: 📋 Follow local safety and environmental codes (e.g., OSHA in the U.S.).

🧍‍♂️ Personal Safety

  • Disconnect power before repairs: 🔌 Prevents electric shock and component damage.
  • Lifting techniques: 🏋️‍♂️ Use legs, not back—get help for heavy objects.
  • Electrical fire safety: 🔥 Know where to find a Class C extinguisher, appropriate for electrical fires.
  • Safety goggles: 🕶️ Protect eyes from sparks or debris.
  • Air filtration mask: 😷 Use when cleaning dusty systems or in enclosed, particle-heavy spaces.
